decks.notes: This deck aims to control the game by utilizing UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and drop powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers. With cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms, the deck can disrupt opponents' strategies while deploying threats of its own. By using a combination of removal spells and disruptive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, the deck can maintain board control and overwhelm opponents with its powerful late-game threats. The key concept revolves around efficiently using mana resources to dominate the game and outvalue opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble and utilize a combo utilizing cards like Thundertrap Trainer, Goblin Charbelcher, and Hydroelectric Specimen to generate a win condition without relying on traditional lands. It also incorporates control elements like Jwari Disruption and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's strategy, along with card draw and tutoring abilities to ensure consistency in executing the combo. The deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents through a unique and powerful combination of cards while maintaining a flexible and adaptable game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour. Once these creatures are in the graveyard, the deck utilizes cards like Persist and Unearth to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick and powerful reanimation combo. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game while setting up the reanimation strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm your opponent with cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off opponents or clear the way for your creatures. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game with card draw and cantrips like Mishra's Bauble and Preordain. The inclusion of cards like Violent Urge and Mutagenic Growth provide additional ways to pump up your creatures and sneak in extra damage.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and maximizing land drops to consistently get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield, enabling powerful combo plays and efficient land searching. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate massive amounts of mana, while using cards like Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to the opponent. The combination of ramp, control elements, and powerful finishers makes this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 play.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays combined with burn spells and enchantments to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to play low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride to deal damage early, while using support cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for additional damage and control. The deck also utilizes cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's mana base and board state, allowing for a decisive victory through relentless aggression.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggression and control, using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes elements of disruption with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to control the board and prevent the opponent from stabilizing. The deck utilizes a mix of burn spells and combat tricks to maintain pressure on the opponent, while also incorporating cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional value and reach. Overall, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It controls the board with spells like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble while also utilizing land destruction with cards like Ghost Quarter. The key strategy is to overwhelm opponents with large threats early in the game and disrupt their game plan with control elements, ultimately dominating the board and securing victory.

The key focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Guide of Souls, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently and effectively. Additionally, cards like Goblin Bombardment and Lightning Bolt provide additional reach to finish off opponents. The deck also includes Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory to provide support and help maintain board presence. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games swiftly.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruption to control the game. It utilizes cards that benefit from being in the graveyard, such as Emperor of Bones and Shadowy Backstreet. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly establish a board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy to close out the game efficiently. The deck combines aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent and control the tempo of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly playing artifacts and using them to generate advantage, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game with aggressive creatures. The deck includes cards that can manipulate the graveyard, interact with the opponent's board, and generate card advantage. It aims to swarm the board with artifacts, using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to constantly bring them back from the graveyard. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to eliminate threats and clear the way for attacks.

The key concept of this deck is to use a combination of countermagic and control elements to protect and enable the combo win condition of Goblin Charbelcher. By using cards like Disrupting Shoal, Spell Snare, and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan, and cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to fuel the Charbelcher combo, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces and deal lethal damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck forgoes traditional land cards in favor of a more streamlined and explosive strategy.

The main idea of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to deal early damage. The deck also focuses on generating value through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration, while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck aims to be aggressive and proactive, punishing opponents who cannot keep up with its quick pace.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo win condition using cards that don't require lands to function effectively. The strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while getting key pieces into play to eventually win the game with cards like Goblin Charbelcher. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for key cards, while cards like Waterlogged Teachings and Whir of Invention help find combo pieces. The deck aims to control the game until it can assemble its win condition and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently bringing powerful creatures back from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. These creatures, like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, have strong abilities that can quickly turn the tide of the game in the player's favor. The deck also includes a mix of disruption and removal spells to control the board and protect the combo. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and game-changing effects.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Birthing Ritual card to ramp up mana quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By using cards like Coiling Oracle and Ice-Fang Coatl for early board presence, and Quantum Riddler and Abhorrent Oculus for damage, the deck aims to control the game tempo and finish off the opponent with powerful finishers like Harbinger of the Seas and Hydroelectric Specimen. The inclusion of counterspells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation adds an element of protection to ensure the deck's strategy goes smoothly.
